data.gloss:
ab (awb) n-m.
1. father
{in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application}
[a primitive word. Compare names beginning with "Abi-"]
KJV: chief, (fore-)father(-less), X patrimony, principal.

ab (ab) n-m.
1. father
[(Aramaic) corresponding to H1]
 Root(s): H1

'eb (abe) n-m.
1. a green plant
[from the same as H24]
KJV: greenness, fruit. 
Root(s): H24

eb (abe) n-m.
1. fruit
[(Aramaic) corresponding to H3]
 Root(s): H3

Abagtha' (ab-ag-thaw') n/p.
1. Abagtha, a eunuch of Xerxes
[of foreign origin]
KJV: Abagtha.

abad (aw-bad') v.
1. (properly) to wander away, i.e. lose oneself
2. (by implication) to perish
3. (causative) to destroy
[a primitive root]
KJV: break, destroy(- uction), + not escape, fail, lose, (cause to, make) perish, spend, X and surely, take, be undone, X utterly, be void of, have no way to flee.

abad (ab-ad') v.
1. destroy, perish
[(Aramaic) corresponding to H6]
 Root(s): H6

obed (o-bade') n-m.
1. (concretely) wretched
2. (abstractly) destruction
[active of participle of H6]
KJV: perish. 
Root(s): H6

abedah (ab-ay-daw') n-f.
1. (concretely) something lost
2. (abstractly) destruction, i.e. Hades
[from H6]
KJV: lost. 
Root(s): H6 
Compare: H10

abaddoh (ab-ad-do') n-f.
1. a perishing
[the same as H9, miswritten for H11]
KJV: destruction. 
Root(s): H9, H11

abaddown (ab-ad-done') n/l.
1. (abstractly) a perishing
2. (concretely) Hades
[intensive from H6]
KJV: destruction. 
Root(s): H6

abdan (ab-dawn') n-m.
1. a perishing
[from H6]
KJV: destruction. 
Root(s): H6

obdan (ob-dawn') n-m.
1. a perishing
[from H6]
KJV: destruction. 
Root(s): H6

abah (aw-baw') v.
1. to breathe after
2. (figuratively) to be acquiescent
[a primitive root]
KJV: consent, rest content will, be willing.

abeh (aw-beh') n-f.
1. longing
[from H14]
KJV: desire. 
Root(s): H14

ebeh (ay-beh') n-m.
1. the papyrus
[from H14 (in the sense of bending toward)]
KJV: swift. 
Root(s): H14

abowy (ab-o'ee) inj.
1. want
[from H14 (in the sense of desiring)]
KJV: sorrow. 
Root(s): H14

ebuwc (ay-booce') n-m.
1. a manger or stall
[from H75]
KJV: crib. 
Root(s): H75

ibchah (ib-khaw') n-f.
1. brandishing of a sword
[from an unused root (apparently meaning to turn)]
KJV: point.

abattiyach (ab-at-tee'-akh) n-m.
1. a melon (only plural)
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: melon.

Abiy (ab-ee') n/p.
1. fatherly
2. Abi, Hezekiah's mother
[from H1]
KJV: Abi. 
Root(s): H1

Abiy'el (ab-ee-ale') n/p.
1. father (i.e. possessor) of God
2. Abiel, the name of two Israelites
[from H1 and H410]
KJV: Abiel. 
Root(s): H1, H410

Abiy'acaph (ab-ee-aw-sawf') n/p.
1. father of gathering (i.e. gatherer)
2. Abiasaph, an Israelite
[from H1 and H622]
KJV: Abiasaph. 
Root(s): H1, H622

abiyb (aw-beeb') n-m.
1. green, i.e. a young ear of grain
2. (hence) the name of the month Abib or Nisan
[from an unused root (meaning to be tender)]
KJV: Abib, ear, green ears of corn (not maize).

Abiy Gib`own (ab-ee' ghib-one') n/p.
1. father (i.e. founder) of Gibon
2. Abi-Gibon, perhaps an Israelite
[from H1 and H1391]
KJV: father of Gibeon. 
Root(s): H1, H1391

Abiygayil (ab-ee-gah'-yil) (or shorter Abiygal {ab-ee-gal'}) n/p.
1. father (i.e. source) of joy
2. Abigail or Abigal, the name of two Israelitesses
[from H1 and H1524]
KJV: Abigal. 
Root(s): H1, H1524

Abiydan (ab-ee-dawn') n/p.
1. father of judgment (i.e. judge)
2. Abidan, an Israelite
[from H1 and H1777]
KJV: Abidan. 
Root(s): H1, H1777

Abiyda` (ab-ee-daw') n/p.
1. father of knowledge (i.e. knowing)
2. Abida, a son of Abraham by Keturah
[from H1 and H3045]
KJV: Abida, Abidah. 
Root(s): H1, H3045

Abiyah (ab-ee-yaw') (or prolonged Abiyahuw {ab-ee-yaw'-hoo}) n/p.
1. father (i.e. worshipper) of Jah
2. Abijah, the name of several Israelite men and two Israelitesses
[from H1 and H3050]
KJV: Abiah, Abijah. 
Root(s): H1, H3050

Abiyhuw' (ab-ee-hoo') n/p.
1. father (i.e. worshipper) of Him (i.e. God)
2. Abihu, a son of Aaron
[from H1 and H1931]
KJV: Abihu. 
Root(s): H1, H1931

Abiyhuwd (ab-ee-hood') n/p.
1. father (i.e. possessor) of renown
2. Abihud, the name of two Israelites
[from H1 and H1935]
KJV: Abihud. 
Root(s): H1, H1935

Abiyhayil (ab-ee-hah'-yil) (or (more correctly) hAbiychayil {ab-ee- khah'-yil}) n/p.
1. father (i.e. possessor) of might
2. Abihail or Abichail, the name of three Israelites and two Israelitesses
[from H1 and H2428]
KJV: Abihail. 
Root(s): H2428

Abiy ha-`Ezriy (ab-ee'-haw-ez-ree') n/p.
1. father of the Ezrite
2. an Abiezrite or descendant of Abiezer
[from H44 with the article inserted]
KJV: Abiezrite. 
Root(s): H44

ebyown (eb-yone') adj.
1. destitute
[from H14, in the sense of want (especially in feeling)]
KJV: beggar, needy, poor (man). 
Root(s): H14

abiyownah (ab-ee-yo-naw') n-f.
1. provocative of desire
2. the caper berry (from its stimulative taste)
[from H14]
KJV: desire. 
Root(s): H14

Abiytuwb (ab-ee-toob') n/p.
1. father of goodness (i.e. good)
2. Abitub, an Israelite
[from H1 and H2898]
KJV: Abitub. 
Root(s): H1, H2898

Abiytal (ab-ee-tal') n/p.
1. father of dew (i.e. fresh)
2. Abital, a wife of King David
[from H1 and H2919]
KJV: Abital. 
Root(s): H1, H2919

Abiyam (ab-ee-yawm') n/p.
1. father of (the) sea (i.e. seaman)
2. Abijam (or Abijah), a king of Judah
[from H1 and H3220]
KJV: Abijam. 
Root(s): H1, H3220

Abiyma'el (ab-ee-maw-ale') n/p.
1. father of Mael (apparently some Arab tribe)
2. Abimael, a son of Joktan
[from H1 and an elsewhere unused (probably foreign) word]
KJV: Abimael. 
Root(s): H1

Abiymelek (ab-ee-mel'-ek) n/p.
1. father of (the) king
2. Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites
[from H1 and H4428]
KJV: Abimelech. 
Root(s): H1, H4428

Abiynadab (ab-ee-naw-dawb') n/p.
1. father of generosity (i.e. liberal)
2. Abinadab, the name of four Israelites
[from H1 and H5068]
KJV: Abinadab. 
Root(s): H1, H5068

Abiyno`am (ab-ee-no'-am) n/p.
1. father of pleasantness (i.e. gracious)
2. Abinoam, an Israelite
[from H1 and H5278]
KJV: Abinoam. 
Root(s): H1, H5278

Ebyacaph (eb-yaw-sawf') n/p.
1. Ebjasaph, an Israelite
[contracted from H23]
KJV: Ebiasaph. 
Root(s): H23

Abiy`ezer (ab-ee-ay'-zer) n/p.
1. father of help (i.e. helpful)
2. Abiezer, the name of two Israelites
[from H1 and H5829]
KJV: Abiezer. 
Root(s): H1, H5829

Abiy-`albown (ab-ee-al-bone') n/p.
1. probably, father of strength (i.e. valiant)
2. Abialbon, an Israelite
[from H1 and and an unused root of uncertain. derivation]
KJV: Abialbon. 
Root(s): H1

abiyr (aw-beer') adj.
1. mighty (spoken of God)
[from H82]
KJV: mighty (one). 
Root(s): H82

abbiyr (ab-beer') adj.
1. mighty (spoken of created beings
[from H46]
KJV: angel, bull, chiefest, mighty (one), stout(-hearted), strong (one), valiant. 
Root(s): H46

Abiyram (ab-ee-rawm') n/p.
1. father of height (i.e. lofty)
2. Abiram, the name of two Israelites
[from H1 and H7311]
KJV: Abiram. 
Root(s): H1, H7311

Abiyshag (ab-ee-shag') n/p.
1. father of error (i.e. blundering)
2. Abishag, a concubine of David
[from H1 and H7686]
KJV: Abishag. 
Root(s): H1, H7686

Abiyshuwae (ab-ee-shoo'-ah) n/p.
1. father of plenty (i.e. prosperous)
2. Abishua, the name of two Israelites
[from H1 and H7771]
KJV: Abishua. 
Root(s): H1, H7771

Abiyshuwr (ab-ee-shoor') n/p.
1. father of (the) wall (i.e. perhaps mason)
2. Abishur, an Israelite
[from H1 and H7791]
KJV: Abishur. 
Root(s): H1, H7791

Abiyshay (ab-ee-shah'ee) (or (shorter) Abshay {ab-shah'ee}) n/p.
1. father of a gift (i.e. probably generous)
2. Abishai, an Israelite
[from H1 and H7862]
KJV: Abishai. 
Root(s): H1, H7862

Abiyshalowm (ab-ee-shaw-lome') (or (shortened) bAbshalowm {ab-shaw- lome'}) n/p.
1. father of peace (i.e. friendly)
2. Abshalom, a son of David
3. (also, the fuller form) a later Israelite
[from H1 and H7965]
KJV: Abishalom, Absalom. 
Root(s): H1, H7965

Ebyathar (ab-yaw-thawr') n/p.
1. father of abundance (i.e. liberal)
2. Ebjathar, an Israelite
[contracted from H1 and H3498]
KJV: Abiathar. 
Root(s): H1, H3498

abak (aw-bak') v.
1. probably to coil upward
[a primitive root]
KJV: mount up.

abal (aw-bal') v.
1. to bewail
[a primitive root]
KJV: lament, mourn.

abel (aw-bale') adj.
1. lamenting
[from H56]
KJV: mourn(-er, -ing). 
Root(s): H56

abel (aw-bale') n-f.
1. a meadow
[from an unused root (meaning to be grassy)]
KJV: plain. 
Compare: also, the, proper, names, beginning, with, Abel-

Abel (aw-bale') n/l.
1. a meadow
2. Abel, the name of two places in Israel
[from H58]
KJV: Abel. 
Root(s): H58

ebel (ay'-bel) n-m.
1. lamentation
[from H56]
KJV: mourning. 
Root(s): H56

abal (ab-awl') adv.
1. nay, i.e. truly or yet
[apparently from H56 through the idea of negation]
KJV: but, indeed, nevertheless, verily. 
Root(s): H56

Abel Beyth-Ma`akah (aw-bale' bayth ma-a-kaw') n/l.
1. meadow of Beth-Maakah
2. Abel of Beth-maakah, a place in Israel
[from H58 and H1004 and H4601]
KJV: Abel-beth-maachah, Abel of Beth-maachah, 
Root(s): H58, H1004, H4601

Abel hash-Shittiym (aw-bale' hash-shit-teem') n/l.
1. meadow of the acacias
2. Abel hash- Shittim, a place in Israel
[from H58 and the plural of H7848, with the article inserted]
KJV: Abel-shittim. 
Root(s): H58, H7848

Abel Kramiym (aw-bale' ker-aw-meem') n/l.
1. meadow of vineyards
2. Abel-Keramim, a place in Israel
[from H58 and the plural of H3754]
KJV: plain of the vineyards. 
Root(s): H58, H3754

Abel Mchowlah (aw-bale' mekh-o-law') n/l.
1. meadow of dancing
2. Abel-Mecholah, a place in Israel
[from H58 and H4246]
KJV: Abel-meholah. 
Root(s): H58, H4246

Abel Mayim (aw-bale' mah'-yim) n/l.
1. meadow of water
2. Abel-Majim, a place in Israel
[from H58 and H4325]
KJV: Abel-maim. 
Root(s): H58, H4325

Abel Mitsrayim (aw-bale' mits-rah'-yim) n/l.
1. meadow of Egypt
2. Abel-Mitsrajim, a place in Israel
[from H58 and H4714]
KJV: Abel-mizraim. 
Root(s): H58, H4714

eben (eh'-ben) n-f.
1. a stone
[from the root of H1129 through the meaning to build]
KJV: + carbuncle, + mason, + plummet, (chalk-, hail-, head-, sling-)stone(-ny), (divers) weight(-s). 
Root(s): H1129

eben (eh'-ben) n-f.
1. stone
[(Aramaic) corresponding to H68]
 Root(s): H68

oben (o'ben) n-m.
1. a pair of stones (only dual)
2. a potter's wheel or a midwife's stool (consisting alike of two horizontal disks with a support between)
[from the same as H68]
KJV: wheel, stool. 
Root(s): H68

Abanah (ab-aw-naw') n/l.
1. stony
2. Abanah, a river near Damascus
[perhaps feminine of H68]
KJV: Abana. 
Root(s): H68 
Compare: H549

Eben ha-`ezer (eh'-ben haw-e'-zer) n/l.
1. stone of the help
2. Eben-ha-Ezer, a place in Israel
[from H68 and H5828 with the article inserted]
KJV: Ebenezer. 
Root(s): H68, H5828

abnet (ab-nate') n-m.
1. a belt
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: girdle.

Abner (ab-nare') (or (fully) nAbiyner {ab-ee-nare'}) n/p.
1. father of light (i.e. enlightening)
2. Abner, an Israelite
[from H1 and H5216]
KJV: Abner. 
Root(s): H1, H5216

abac (aw-bas') v.
1. to fodder
[a primitive root]
KJV: fatted, stalled.

aba`bu`ah (ab-ah-boo-aw') n-f.
1. an inflammatory pustule (as eruption)
[(by reduplication) from an unused root (meaning to belch forth)]
KJV: blains.

Ebets (eh'-bets) n/l.
1. conspicuous
2. Ebets, a place in Israel
[from an unused root probably meaning to gleam]
KJV: Abez.

Ibtsan (ib-tsawn') n/p.
1. splendid
2. Ibtsan, an Israelite
[from the same as H76]
KJV: Ibzan. 
Root(s): H76

abaq (aw-bak') v.
1. to bedust, i.e. grapple
[a primitive root, probably to float away (as vapor), but used only as denominative from H80]
KJV: wrestle. 
Root(s): H80

abaq (aw-bawk') n-m.
1. light particles (as volatile)
[from root of H79]
KJV: (small) dust, powder. 
Root(s): H79

abaqah (ab-aw-kaw') n-f.
1. powder
[feminine of H80]
 Root(s): H80

abar (aw-bar') v.
1. to soar
[a primitive root]
KJV: fly.

eber (ay-ber') n-m.
1. a pinion
[from H82]
KJV: (long-)wing(-ed). 
Root(s): H82

ebrah (eb-raw') n-f.
1. feather, wing
[feminine of H83]
 Root(s): H83

Abraham (ab-raw-hawm') n/p.
1. father of a multitude
2. Abraham, the later name of Abram
[contracted from H1 and an unused root (probably meaning to be populous)]
KJV: Abraham. 
Root(s): H1

abrek (ab-rake') inj.
1. bow the knee
[probably an Egyptian word meaning kneel]

Abram (ab-rawm') n/p.
1. high father
2. Abram, the original name of Abraham
[contracted from H48]
KJV: Abram. 
Root(s): H48

oboth (o-both') n/l.
1. water-skins
2. Oboth, a place in the Desert
[plural of H178]
KJV: Oboth. 
Root(s): H178

Age' (aw-gay') n/p.
1. Age, an Israelite
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: Agee. 
Compare: H90

Agag (ag-ag') (or uAgag {Ag-awg'}) n/p.
1. flame
2. Agag, a title of Amalekitish kings
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: Agag. 
Compare: H89

Agagiy (ag-aw-ghee') adj.
1. an Agagite or descendent (subject) of Agag
[patrial or patronymic from H90]
KJV: Agagite. 
Root(s): H90

aguddah (ag-ood-daw') n-f.
1. a band, bundle, knot, or arch
[feminine passive participle of an unused root (meaning to bind)]
KJV: bunch, burden, troop.

egowz (eg-oze') n-m.
1. a nut
[prob of Persian origin]
KJV: nut.

Aguwr (aw-goor') n/p.
1. gathered (i.e. received among the sages)
2. Agur, a fanciful name for Solomon
[passive participle of H103]
KJV: Agur. 
Root(s): H103

agowrah (ag-o-raw') n-f.
1. (properly) something gathered, i.e. perhaps a grain or berry
2. used only of a small (silver) coin
[from the same as H94]
KJV: piece (of) silver. 
Root(s): H94

egel (eh'-ghel) n-m.
1. a reservoir
[from an unused root (meaning to flow down or together as drops)]
KJV: drop.

Eglayim (eg-lah'-yim) n/l.
1. a double pond
2. Eglajim, a place in Moab
[dual of H96]
KJV: Eglaim. 
Root(s): H96

agam (ag-am') n-m.
1. a marsh
2. hence a rush (as growing in swamps)
3. hence a stockade of reeds
[from an unused root (meaning to collect as water)]
KJV: pond, pool, standing (water).

agem (aw-game') adj.
1. figuratively, sad
[probably from the same as H98 (in the sense of stagnant water)]
KJV: pond. 
Root(s): H98

agmown (ag-mone') n-m.
1. a marshy pool (others from a different root, a kettle)
2. (by implication) a rush (as growing there)
3. (collectively) a rope of rushes
[from the same as H98]
KJV: bulrush, caldron, hook, rush. 
Root(s): H98

aggan (ag-gawn') n-m.
1. a bowl (as pounded out hollow)
[probably from H5059]
KJV: basin, cup, goblet. 
Root(s): H5059

aggaph (ag-gawf') n-m.
1. a cover or heap
2. i.e. (only plural) wings of an army, or crowds of troops
[probably from H5062 (through the idea of impending)]
KJV: bands. 
Root(s): H5062

agar (aw-gar') v.
1. to harvest
[a primitive root]
KJV: gather.

iggra' (ig-er-aw') n-f.
1. an epistle (as carried by a state courier or postman)
[(Aramaic) of Persian origin]
KJV: letter.

agartal (ag-ar-tawl') n-m.
1. a basin
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: charger.

egroph (eg-rofe') n-m.
1. the clenched hand
[from H1640 (in the sense of grasping)]
KJV: fist. 
Root(s): H1640

iggereth (ig-eh'-reth) n-f.
1. an epistle
[feminine of H104]
KJV: letter. 
Root(s): H104

ed (ade) n-m.
1. a fog
[from the same as H181 (in the sense of enveloping)]
KJV: mist, vapor. 
Root(s): H181

adab (aw-dab') v.
1. to languish
[a primitive root]
KJV: grieve.

Adb'el (ad-beh-ale') n/p.
1. disciplined of God
2. Adbeel, a son of Ishmael
[probably from H109 (in the sense of chastisement) and H410]
KJV: Adbeel. 
Root(s): H109, H410

Adad (ad-ad') n/p.
1. Adad (or Hadad), an Edomite
[probably an orthographical variation for H2301]
KJV: Hadad. 
Root(s): H2301

Iddow (id-do) n/p.
1. Iddo, an Israelite
[of uncertain derivation]
KJV: Iddo.

adown (aw-done') (or (shortened) adon {aw-done'}) n-m.
1. sovereign, i.e. controller (human or divine)
[from an unused root (meaning to rule)]
KJV: lord, master, owner. 
Compare: also, names, beginning, with, "Adoni-"

Addown (ad-done') adj.
1. powerful
2. Addon, apparently an Israelite
[probably intensive for H113]
KJV: Addon. 
Root(s): H113

Adowrayim (ad-o-rah'-yim) n/l.
1. double mound
2. Adorajim, a place in Israel
[dual from H142 (in the sense of eminence)]
KJV: Adoraim. 
Root(s): H142

edayin (ed-ah'-yin) adv.
1. then (of time)
[(Aramaic) of uncertain derivation]
KJV: now, that time, then.

addiyr (ad-deer') adj.
1. wide
2. (generally) large
3. (figuratively) powerful
[from H142]
KJV: excellent, famous, gallant, glorious, goodly, lordly, mighty(- ier one), noble, principal, worthy. 
Root(s): H142

Adalya' (ad-al-yaw') n/p.
1. Adalja, a son of Haman
[of Persian derivation]
KJV: Adalia.

adam (aw-dam') v.
1. be (dyed, made) red (ruddy)
[to show blood (in the face), i.e. flush or turn rosy]

adam (aw-dawm') n-m.
1. ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
[from H119]
KJV: X another, + hypocrite, + common sort, X low, man (mean, of low degree), person. 
Root(s): H119

Adam (aw-dawm') n/p.
1. Adam the name of the first man, also of a place in Israel
[the same as H120]
KJV: Adam. 
Root(s): H120

adom (aw-dome') adj.
1. rosy
[from H119]
KJV: red, ruddy. 
Root(s): H119

Edom (ed-ome') (or (fully) oEdowm {ed-ome'}) n/p.
1. red (see Gen. 25
2. Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob
3. hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
[from H122]
KJV: Edom, Edomites, Idumea. 
Root(s): H122

odem (o'-dem) n-f.
1. redness, i.e. the ruby, garnet, or some other red gem
[from H119]
KJV: sardius. 
Root(s): H119

adamdam (ad-am-dawm') adj.
1. reddish
[reduplicated from H119]
KJV: (somewhat) reddish. 
Root(s): H119

Admah (ad-maw') n/l.
1. earthy
2. Admah, a place near the Dead Sea
[contracted for H127]

KJV: deliverance, help, safety, salvation, victory.

tshuwqah (tesh-oo-kaw') n-f.

[from H7783 in the original sense of stretching out after]
KJV: desire.

tshuwrah (tesh-oo-raw') n-f.

[from H7788 in the sense of arrival]
KJV: present.

tshiy`iy (tesh-ee-ee') adj.

tesha` (tay'-shah) (or (masculine) tishtah {tish-aw'}) n-e.

KJV: nine (+ -teen, + -teenth, -th).

tish`iym (tish-eem') num.
